title: The Neutral Typeface
content:
This doesn't seem to have come up before: Kai Bernau's project, now completed and on sale, to create the least remarkable sans possible. It's at [http://letterlabor.de/typeface.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307043416/http:/letterlabor.de/typeface.php "http://letterlabor.de/typeface.php").

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307043416im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Neutral_6172.PNG)
author: George Horton

comments.content: I highly recommend Kai's [book](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307043416/http:/letterlabor.de/book.php) on the making of Neutral. Excerpts will be published in the next issue of the [SOTA](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307043416/http:/typophile.com/wiki/SOTA) publication _[Interrobang](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307043416/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Interrobang)_ which will be available at [TypeCon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307043416/http:/typecon.com/) in Seattle.

It looks like a well constructed font, based on a well constructed philosophy. Given that his intended audience includes primarily the conceptual artist (from Kai's book), the idealogical underpinnings are sure to appeal. That said, I don't think it really adds anything new to the typographic landscape. Hats off to him though, I'll wager he learned a bundle in the process (ed. I did from reading the book excerpt, thanks for that). Congratulations on it's release. -- R
